    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Starsong Nectar](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2093)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Potion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=130" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 91 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 14,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104))</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A liquid with the appearance of an expressive night sky and a taste that’s sheer pleasure, _starsong nectar_ grants you cheerful confidence and incredible luck for 10 minutes after you drink it. However, if you show too much caution at any point during this time (GM’s discretion), you must succeed at a DC 6 [flat check](/Rules.aspx?ID=333) or the potion’s effects end. While the potion lasts, you gain a +3 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks, and you aren’t [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to creatures due to them [flanking](/Rules.aspx?ID=2375) you or being [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) from or undetected by you. You are temporarily immune to this potion for 24 hours once its effects end.

While the potion lasts, though, if you take a moment to imagine the future, you choose the best courses of action. This aspect of the potion grants you the following activation.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561)) **Frequency** once per round;   **Effect** Until the start of your next turn, roll two d20s for any attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks you make and take the higher result.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
